doc:
Nella Bielski https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nella_Bielski 0 Nella Bielski is a Ukrainian-born French writer and actress. Bielski was born in Ukraine in the Soviet Union in the 1930s. She studied philosophy at Moscow State University. In the early 1960s she met a French journalist, married him and was allowed to leave the Soviet Union for France. Bielski acted in films. In 1970 her first novel Voronej appeared in French. Since then she has written a number of novels, also translated into English, including Oranges for the Son of Alexander Levy and The Year is '42. She has collaborated on a number of plays with one of her regular English translators John Berger, including A Question of Geography, which has been performed by the Royal Shakespeare Company. Nella_Bielski is a_Ukrainian-born_French_writer_and_actress . Bielski was_born in Ukraine in the_Soviet_Union in the_1930s . She studied philosophy at Moscow_State_University . In the_early_1960s she met a_French_journalist , married him and was_allowed_to_leave the_Soviet_Union for France . Bielski acted in films . In 1970_her_first_novel_Voronej appeared in French . Since then she has_written a_number of novels , also_translated into English , including Oranges for the_Son of Alexander_Levy and The_Year is '_42 . She has_collaborated on a_number of plays with one of her_regular_English_translators_John_Berger , including A_Question of Geography , which has_been_performed by the_Royal_Shakespeare_Company .
